about.summary: Provides methods for extracting from a weighted graph a binary or signed backbone that retains only the significant edges. The user may input a weighted graph, or a bipartite graph from which a weighted graph is first constructed via projection. Backbone extraction methods include the stochastic degree sequence model (SDSM; Neal, Z. P. (2014). <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2014.06.001>), the fixed degree sequence model (FDSM; Zweig, K. A., and Kaufmann, M. (2011). <doi:10.1007/s13278-011-0021-0>), the fixed row model (FRM; Neal, Z. P. (2013). <doi:10.1007/s13278-013-0107-y>), the fixed column model (FCM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), the fixed fill model (FFM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), and a universal threshold method.

Provides methods for extracting from a weighted graph a binary or signed backbone that retains only the significant edges. The user may input a weighted graph, or a bipartite graph from which a weighted graph is first constructed via projection. Backbone extraction methods include the stochastic degree sequence model (SDSM; Neal, Z. P. (2014). <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2014.06.001>), the fixed degree sequence model (FDSM; Zweig, K. A., and Kaufmann, M. (2011). <doi:10.1007/s13278-011-0021-0>), the fixed row model (FRM; Neal, Z. P. (2013). <doi:10.1007/s13278-013-0107-y>), the fixed column model (FCM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), the fixed fill model (FFM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), and a universal threshold method.

name: r-backbone
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.5.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-backbone
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/backbone_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/backbone/backbone_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 43cea94508d5c074aca959941e6e306ba7db3669b1af89365d9843bfc835a51d

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-poissonbinomial
    - r-igraph
    - r-network
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-poissonbinomial
    - r-igraph
    - r-network

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('backbone')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('backbone')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://www.zacharyneal.com/backbone, https://github.com/domagal9/backbone
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Provides methods for extracting from a weighted graph a binary or signed backbone
    that retains only the significant edges. The user may input a weighted graph, or
    a bipartite graph from which a weighted graph is first constructed via projection.
    Backbone extraction methods include the stochastic degree sequence model (SDSM;
    Neal, Z. P. (2014). <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2014.06.001>), the fixed degree sequence
    model (FDSM; Zweig, K. A., and Kaufmann, M. (2011). <doi:10.1007/s13278-011-0021-0>),
    the fixed row model (FRM; Neal, Z. P. (2013). <doi:10.1007/s13278-013-0107-y>),
    the fixed column model (FCM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>),
    the fixed fill model (FFM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>),
    and a universal threshold method.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: backbone
# Type: Package
# Title: Extracts the Backbone from Weighted Graphs
# Version: 1.5.0
# Authors@R: c( person("Zachary", "Neal", email = "zpneal@msu.edu", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("Rachel", "Domagalski", email = "domagal9@msu.edu", role = "aut"), person("Bruce", "Sagan", email = "bsagan@msu.edu", role = "aut"))
# Description: Provides methods for extracting from a weighted graph a binary or signed backbone that retains only the significant edges. The user may input a weighted graph, or a bipartite graph from which a weighted graph is first constructed via projection. Backbone extraction methods include the stochastic degree sequence model (SDSM; Neal, Z. P. (2014). <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2014.06.001>), the fixed degree sequence model (FDSM; Zweig, K. A., and Kaufmann, M. (2011). <doi:10.1007/s13278-011-0021-0>), the fixed row model (FRM; Neal, Z. P. (2013). <doi:10.1007/s13278-013-0107-y>), the fixed column model (FCM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), the fixed fill model (FFM; Neal, Domagalski, and Sagan (2021). <arXiv:2105.13396>), and a universal threshold method.
